reviews.text: Major transport hub, particularly for central and south west Scotland. Short staffed, generally busy, often long queues at weekends for ticket machines, ticket office and platforms. Usual fast food, cafes and self service(?) WH Smiths and M&S. Good florist and station tour a must. Very handy for city centre.

Provides great service. Plenty coffee shops/resteraunts inside and outside to eat/drink in between journeys. Right in the centre of Glasgow near all amenities. Public toilets inside. 
Easy Wheelchair access in and out. Taxi ramp outside cars always available.
Central Hotel in station. Buses, Underground Station and Queens Street Station all walking distance/ minutes away. Ticket Office on site. All good 👍🏻 x

What a beautiful station. This building is so unique to welcome travellers. Staff is wonderful and very organised with traffic control. Security from police is important to have on premises. We will come back for a visit one day. Thank you Glasgow!
They are very helpful plenty of staff to help you get your train and help you on the train. Would give them 10 out of 10 from top to bottom staff are tops gold star .
One of the places in Glasgow I always enjoyed visiting.  Lots of history in this place, welcomes you to Glasgow.
